content:
I'm glad to hear that your writing accountability group has been helpful. It's great that you've found a supportive community of writers who can motivate and encourage you to reach your writing goals.

As we discussed earlier, I've been keeping a daily journal since February 10th, and it's been a game-changer for my writing habits. I've found that writing every morning helps me clear my mind and get my thoughts organized. I've also been experimenting with freewriting, which has been really helpful in getting my creative juices flowing.

Speaking of creativity, I've been thinking about trying my hand at writing poetry. I haven't written a proper poem in years, but I've been scribbling lines in my journal and I think it could be a fun challenge. Do you have any tips or advice for someone looking to get started with writing poetry?
